title: Isolate the Radical
text: Isolate the radical on one side of the equation. We can add $$11$$ on both sides get $$\sqrt{12u+1}=11$$ which has radicals isolated on one side.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To The Power Of The Index
speech: the square root of 12 u plus 1 end root, squared is equal to, 11 squared \nAfter squaring both sides, we get  12 u plus 1 is equal to 121 .
